newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka rupee dips on oveseas dollar gains.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka rupee dips on oveseas dollar gains.

text.p: The Sri Lankan rupee was lower against the dollar in early Friday trade, as banks bought the U.S. currency due to its overseas gains, dealers said.
At 0500 GMT the rupee was at 58.53 to the dollar, after opening at 58.50 and falling to 58.57, they said.
"There was buying of dollars after the Central Bank pushed up the currency in line with overseas gains," said an American Express Bank dealer.
The Central Bank pushed up the dollar by three local cents, fixing buying and selling prices at 58.2145 and 59.3905.
Overnight call money rates were at 13.75 after opening at 14 and rising to 15, dealers said.

"Money is a bit tight due to cash going out of the system for quarterly tax payment," said a Standard Chartered Bank dealer. "But rates should not rise over about 15, at which level there are plenty of lenders."
